markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Ganzi](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1266)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Children of primeval chaos, ganzis intertwine the churning pandemonium of the [Maelstrom](/Planes.aspx?ID=19) with the more mundane tumult of mortal life. Some arise in bloodlines touched by creatures of chaos in generations previous, while others are changed by planar friction as the Maelstrom seethes upon the shores of creation, but all share the essence of anarchy in their blood and bone.

 As children of chaos, ganzis vary wildly in appearance; [protean](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=82)-kin remain the most common, with patches of scales and feathers and mischievous slithering tails. Others might have stranger features, such as horns, glowing orange eyes, or limbs flickering with harmless auras of entropic energy. Ganzis might be dramatically shorter, taller, thinner, or stouter than is typical for their ancestry, and it's not uncommon for them to be mistaken for more common planar scions.

 Independent-minded to a fault, often creative and capricious, ganzis prefer professions that allow them to serve as their own masters. If such a profession gives a ganzi opportunity to baffle or befuddle Golarion's more staid citizens, then all the better. Many ganzis develop reputations as outgoing, deviant, or thrill-seeking, and many heartily embrace these reputations and lean into them. Of all the planar scions, ganzis are among the most likely to take up life as wanderers.

 Ganzis with a taste for close combat are sometimes drawn to martial arts, turning their curious forms into potent and unexpected weapons. It's common to find such ganzi in the temporary employ of others, whether out of a legitimately shared ideology or simply the need for money. Just as often, though, one may simply find a ganzi martial artist demonstrating their craft on a street corner or dealing out justice to enforcers of cruel laws.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/PlanarScion_Ganzi.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 3">[Ganzi Martial Artist](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1266)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="CN" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Ganzi" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=339" />
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=90" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 205</row>

**Perception** +9; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Protean](/Languages.aspx?ID=33)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +10, [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +9, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +7, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +7, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +9

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +4

**Con** +0

**Int** -1

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +2
</row>

**Items**
[Explorer's Clothing](/Armor.aspx?ID=2), [Shuriken](/Weapons.aspx?ID=79) (20)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 21 

**Fort** +7 

**Ref** +11 

**Will** +9 

+1 to saves vs. effects that cause the [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=6) condition
</row>

**HP** 36

**Resistances**
acid, electricity, or sonic 1 (chosen randomly each day)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 35 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
foot +11 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)),
**Damage** 1d8+5 bludgeoning

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
shuriken +11 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 1d4+5 piercing

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 19, attack +11
- **2nd**
two of the following chosen at random each day using 1d12 (1: [_acid arrow_](/Spells.aspx?ID=2); 2: [_blur_](/Spells.aspx?ID=28); 3: [_hideous laughter_](/Spells.aspx?ID=150); 4: [_humanoid form_](/Spells.aspx?ID=153); 5: [_illusory object_](/Spells.aspx?ID=160); 6: [_mirror image_](/Spells.aspx?ID=197); 7: [_resist energy_](/Spells.aspx?ID=256); 8: [_see invisibility_](/Spells.aspx?ID=271); 9: [_shatter_](/Spells.aspx?ID=279); 10: [_sound burst_](/Spells.aspx?ID=292); 11: [_spider climb_](/Spells.aspx?ID=299); 12: [_telekinetic maneuver_](/Spells.aspx?ID=333))

**Flurry of Kicks** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Frequency** once per turn; **Effect** The martial artist makes two melee Strikes. The martial artist applies their multiple attack penalty to these Strikes normally.

**Handspring Kick** <actions string="Single Action" />  **Requirements** The martial artist has both hands free; **Effect** The martial artist Steps, then makes a melee Strike at a –1 penalty.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Ganzi Martial Arts</title>

Ganzi martial artists are often drawn to styles that emphasize acrobatics, mobility, flexibility, or artistry. The ganzis of Arcadia are particularly famous for a dancelike style—rarely shared with outsiders—which emphasizes fluid motion over rigid positioning and commonly employs maneuvers such as inverted kicks and sweeping leg strikes. 
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-81" />
name: Ganzi Martial Artist
resistance_markdown: acid, electricity, or sonic 1 (chosen randomly each day)
